alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 31 at 11:11PM MST until September 01 at 7:15AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Yavapai County in west central Arizona... * Until 715 AM MST Friday. * At 1110 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Castle Hot Springs, Coles Bay, Goose Bay, Cottonwood Day Use Area, Pipeline Canyon Trailhead, Humbug Bay and Lake Pleasant. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Bitter Creek, Tussock Spring Creek, French Creek, Black Butte Wash, Whipsaw Creek, Castle Creek, Oak Creek, Minnehaha Creek, Buckhorn Creek, Banty Creek, Jim Creek, Tiger Creek, Cherry Creek, Agua Fria River, Boulder Creek, Ash Creek and Sand Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
